subject: Science
title: Metals, Nonmetals, and Metalloids
description: A quick, practical guide to Metals, Nonmetals, and Metalloids.

hook.text: About 75% of all elements are metals. Most of the rest are nonmetals. A few are in between.

buildup.text: Metals conduct electricity, are shiny, and bend without breaking. They lose electrons easily.

discovery.text: Nonmetals are poor conductors, often gases, and gain electrons in reactions.

twist.text: Metalloids like silicon have properties of both â€” making them perfect for semiconductors.

climax.text: Silicon's half-metal nature is why computer chips work. It conducts only when we tell it to.

punchline.text: Silicon isn't fully metal or nonmetal. That indecision powers every computer on Earth.

quiz.question: Why is silicon ideal for computer chips?
options: It conducts electricity only under certain conditions
